storyInfo: Lemuen is defrocked of her cardinal's vestments after letting Exusiai go. Federico and Arturia break free of the 'dream', and realize the Pope has long since vanished. At this moment, Federico receives a mysterious request to enter the city.

attributes.content: Seems we've come up empty handed.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The room shows little sign of recent human activity. His usual household furniture, such as the rocking chair, coffee maker, and shooting target are all covered with dust...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The terminal shows no communication records or abnormal messages. There is no opportunity to produce any additional evidence for now.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Preliminary deduction: Pope Yvangelista XI has been missing for roughly two weeks.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I only met His Holiness once, and already mentally prepared myself, but to know something really has happened to him...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia, explain.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You seem to have a theory as to where His Holiness has gone.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We meet again, 'Grandpa with the Lateran Candy'.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The Curia's joint trial has already concluded, with your signature on the verdict. The condemned shouldn't be having a private meeting with the Pope, though.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So, what is your decision?
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: So straightforward? I imagined you'd say something like 'I was just taking my post-dessert walk and accidentally bumped into you'.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: As for whether I'm willing to become a so-called 'Saint', I believe we had a thorough discussion on the topic when I was at Rhodes Island—
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We certainly did.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: I'm quite fond of that landship myself. A pity our meeting was so short. I still remember that sunset, when you performed a not-so 'Lateran' piece...
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: I also remember you were hoping for me to provide more evidence.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Do you still remember my words, child? 'That every light we know will one day be extinguished.'
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Hah, it's etched into my mind. It's an interesting expression after all.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That day will soon come... of course, it is just a hunch.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: The Pope points to his own halo.
It's been sending me a lot of warnings lately, but refuses to respond to any of my questions.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: What does that mean?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: To put it another way, our glorious Law is suddenly no longer interpretable.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: I only know how to play the cello, Your Holiness.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Of course, of course. Interpreting holy scripture is the Pope's job.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Trouble has popped up at work, and I have to figure out how to solve it somehow.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: So, what do you need me to do?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Stay vigilant... I'm not sure what exactly will happen, so this is the only thing I can say.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: If the Holy City's lights do go out, then trust in your ideal 'understanding', your ideal 'emotion', the kind of unreserved, pure, and honest 'communication' that you seek.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: An Alienus like you will then perhaps become a panacea, or a poison... but regardless, you will turn things around.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: It sounds as if I have no reason to refuse you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Though I'm not the only Alienus Laterano has.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Indeed, I was just about to contact the other Saints.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: Though I pray we still have the time.
attributes.name: Yvangelista XI

attributes.content: So that is why you began suspecting your surroundings so early.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Not the whole reason, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: One's inner main theme may stay the same, but it's hard for me to miss those supplementary and missing segments, all blended together too seamlessly. Sister Hildegard is a good example.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What concerns me more though, is that the incident happened before His Holiness managed to find you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The situation is too complicated. All of Laterano has fallen into an unfathomable calamity on a scale near to what we experienced in the Witch King's Pavillon.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We require support.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fortunately, I have my cello with me.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Magister?
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: There is no answer.
Vannini walks around the workshop but fails to find her master. She spots a bottle of eye drops on the workbench, uncapped.
Vani! About time!
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: H-Huh?
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: A gun-knight came by earlier and took Paganini away.
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: Before he left, the gun-knight told me to tell you to hurry over to the Curia to assist their investigation.
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: Vani, are you two in some sort of trouble?
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: Either way, you'd better get to the Curia. The gun-knight wasn't in the best of moods.
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: Magister...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: It must be because of her and El. But no matter, she thinks, her master should not get caught up in this.
Wait, these are...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Some bullet casings are scattered on the workbench, as if they were casually left by a careless gunsmith.
Vannini puts on her gloves and begins collecting them as she usually does. But suddenly she feels as if she recognizes these casings, like they're old friends.
The shells are smooth to the touch—even the etchings have been rubbed flat—how many times have they been handled? What kind of bullet casings would receive such care, and in whose hands?
Vannini takes off her gloves. She touches a casing, the metal still slightly warm.
Pag...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Deus meus! Lord Almighty! You scared the glasses off me!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Are you finally going to say something? You're already four, you know? Any Sankta your age should be speaking, with a bright halo over their head!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Alright, I was hallucinating. You still can't talk.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: I would have left this rotten place long ago if I hadn't picked you up by chance. Just thinking about having to live in the same city as that damned Patrizion makes me sick.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: How many hospitals and churches have we been to? Huh? And still, no one has any idea if you were just born like this, or if your 'Lord' has a problem with you...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: It's been three years. You have no halo, and neither do I, so of course I have no clue what's going on in your head. Seems like I've gotten used to my 'little mute' here, and even I myself am growing quieter day by day.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Whatever. You haven't run off in the middle of the night, so I'll just assume you like it here.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: That's enough from me, considering how responsive you are. If you ever want to communicate with me, you'll have to figure out a way yourself.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Vani, let go!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Why the sudden hugging and crying and laughing? Did I flip a switch somewhere...?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: You don't usually respond to anything I say. Are you trying to make up for all these years at once?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Also, what's with the sudden light over your head? Those doctors and clerics treating you the past three years couldn't do a thing...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: But you picked a gun with that Lemuel kid and now you're fine?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Gah, still can't speak, hm? Don't you Sankta sprout halos from your first word? Did your halo come out early because it got impatient?
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: (Grabs her master's hand and nods vigorously)
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: I'm no Sankta, so I don't get how you communicated with that kid through the guardian gun, or how much it mattered to you...
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: In any case, now I know you can understand me perfectly, and that's enough for me.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: (Gripping her master's face feathers)
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Okay, okay, okay! That hurts!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: If you're willing to listen, I can teach you a less violent way to communicate.
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: Sit here—and stay! Look at these bullet casings. Here, I'll teach you—
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: S-Since when... am I able to talk? I shouldn't...
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: To little Vannini, 'understanding' and 'expression' were a pair of rusty doors blocking her from communicating.
She lived with the garrulous and eccentric Liberi for three years, unable to figure out when he was happy or angry, unable to express her own annoyance or adoration.
She never thought a Sankta with both fiery hair and personality would blast a hole into her sealed-off heart without the need for words.

Later, her master pieced small bullet casings together and, word by word, taught her a whole new language. Even after she finally learned some simple phrases, they still used the shells to communicate.

But today she no longer remembers when exactly she did finally manage to grasp the most complex of sentences, let alone how many times she nonchalantly tossed the shells left by her master into the trash.
She dares not imagine his perplexed face as he rubbed the shells they used for more than a decade, wondering why his student no longer cherishes this special language from the depths of her memory.
Through tearful eyes, she realizes once more what those casings mean—it's a warning!
No... Magister!
attributes.name: Vannini

attributes.content: Oh, Vani. I just remembered something that was bothering me.
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: When the gun-knight took Paganini away, it didn't look like they were heading for the Curia.
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: I'd say they were going... toward the Shrine of Nurtury.
attributes.name: Sankta Neighbor

attributes.content: Cardinal Lemuen. Forgive for my tardiness, I was just sorting out the gunsmithy handover documents. There's just so much—
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Why are you here?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Cardinal Aide Amos. Have a seat.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Easy now. Just passing on the Curia's newest orders.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: What kind of orders require your presence—
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: The Curia has decided to suspend all of Cardinal Lemuen's work, and you shall serve as an acting cardinal of the Seventh Tribunal until her work review is complete.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Wh-What?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: You heard me.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: The Seventh Tribunal was raided by unknown forces recently, and the suspect Lemuel, who attempted to disrupt the Summit of Nations, managed to escape during the chaos.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Cardinal Lemuen made contact with the suspect, but released her without authorization.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: After further investigation, it was discovered she acted similarly during the Pagus Stevonus explosion and the attack on the Shrine of Nurtury.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Cardinal Lemuen has engaged in severe violations of the Seventh Tribunal's code of conduct, as well as the Law...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But, why me?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: We wouldn't have captured the suspect without the crucial evidence you provided, and perhaps the Nativity would've been sabotaged.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Amos, you've spent more than a decade in the Seventh Tribunal, correct?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Two more months, and it will be exactly fourteen years.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: You're the oldest functionary here, and are familiar with the Seventh Tribunal's business. Does that not make you the most suitable candidate?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It may have been an absence of opportunity, rather than a personal lack of ability, that has prevented you from playing a more important role.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Be more confident in yourself, boy!
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Reverend Patrizion, I've always felt you did not like me much...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I still remember the first time Aurela and I went to visit you. It was not you, but Fiammetta, who had just came home from school, welcomed us.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I mean, I don't like you.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Aurela was my best student, exceptionally talented in armored combat and firearms. But she had too much of a character, and an extreme way of doing things...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: While you, on the opposite, were too weak... And yet, these are your own choices.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I'll just say this again, I wasn't home that day because my armor broke and needed fixing!
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Besides, if we're going to make it personal between us, you're the one who's holding a deeper grudge, right? I personally expelled Aurela from Laterano, after all.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: When it comes to that... I only blame myself.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: You're right. I'm too weak, and have nothing to my name.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I couldn't help Aurela defuse her anger, even though I was right there with her. And so, she hurt the shackled Sarkaz in the abbey, and ultimately leveled her gun at her own people.
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: And after she made that terrible mistake, I...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I didn't even manage to see her one last time, Reverend Patrizion...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: I... I really can't do anything...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Then think on what you can still do right now.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Now?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: The Summit of Nations is still ongoing, and the Seventh Tribunal has lots of business on hand. You will be temporarily created cardinal, as the Curia has decided.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Handshake review complete. You now have access to cardinal privileges and permissions.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: W-Wait, so fast? I... I still haven't...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Cardinal Amos, in the face of calamity, Laterano must strive for efficiency.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: So, there will be no welcome tea and cake for you.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: With the gun-knight gone, Amos pulls out a chair. He opens his terminal, and his privileges have indeed already been updated, as Patrizion said.
Everything happened so fast he needs some time to adjust... and he suddenly realizes something.
He taps on the file explorer, and scrolls all the way down, finally arriving at his target at the bottom.
He opens the document, his finger pausing on a signature confirmation page.
Aurela, I finally...
attributes.name: Amos

attributes.content: Newly created Cardinal Amos sees a smile on his face reflected on the terminal screen.
It is a little ridiculous, he thinks.
Uh... th-this is...
attributes.name: Sankta A

attributes.content: It's Laterano. We're finally back.
attributes.name: Sankta B

attributes.content: No, something's off... those strangely colored shadows... look at their shapes!
attributes.name: Sankta A

attributes.content: They're projecting... the Shrine of Nurtury?
attributes.name: Sankta B

attributes.content: What's going on? Has Laterano changed, or do we have brain damage?
attributes.name: Sankta A

attributes.content: Watch out! Behind you!
attributes.name: Sankta B

attributes.content: (Praying)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature

attributes.content: A creature with a halo? What?!
attributes.name: Sankta A

attributes.content: There's more and more of them! Wait, stay back, I don't need an extra halo on me—
attributes.name: Sankta B

attributes.content: Nice shot! They don't dodge bullets. We should be fine.
attributes.name: Sankta A

attributes.content: Why do you look so dazed? Let's clear a way out... what's wrong?
attributes.name: Sankta A

attributes.content: You're... fallen?
attributes.name: Sankta A

attributes.content: Our awakenings may have influenced others to wake up as well. But there are also more of these halo-sporting creatures.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Those creatures dragged the awakened into the strangely-colored projections, and then vanished together.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: They did not even manage to retaliate. And the Sankta who shot at those creatures... have fallen?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Fede, I'm afraid my joke from before was no joke at all. These things are... considered Sankta, and thus our people?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How strange and chaotic their hearts sound... what should I listen for within the mess? What should I share with them?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ah... they can't feel our emotions either, and are anxious over it. They desperately want to share theirs, but they can only resort to brute force.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Like an infant yet to grow a halo—no matter what they want to express, they can only cry and grab at their parents' sleeves... Yes, they are our people, just too immature.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Immature, but powerful.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Law grants an infant a halo when it speaks its first word because language represents rationality's awakening.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And rationality refers to a Sankta finally gaining the capacity to be conscientious of both their people and the Law.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Why would the Law deem a pack of nonsentient creatures as 'Sankta', and also compel them to use brute force to intervene in their people's fates?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Anomalies only continue to multiply. Currently, the only individual we may cooperate with is the Doctor. Being present already, the Doctor must know something about the current situation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia, are you certain the Doctor remembers the sound of your strings?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Doctor was almost present at every of my few performances on Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A pity the Doctor was never my intended audience, but I ought to be glad the Doctor seemed to have been listening carefully every single time.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Only your first sentence contained actual information, Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Haha. Sure.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Well then, Fede. I will guide the Doctor with my cello.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A sudden notification beep interrupts the two.
Here and now, of all times...?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Federico checks his communicator.
Hello...? Can... you hear... me?
Aurela... former citizen ID... LC0073458.
A group of errari Sankta and war refugees... currently north of the Lateran City... three kilometers out...
Requesting permission to enter the city.
